root: ^In a small mining town near a railroad line...
^The seasons are changing. Winters and summers are becoming too extreme.
^The God of music and poetry teaches you to write music.

c-0: ^Your father teaches you the importance of your songs.

c-1: ^Regardless, your father teaches you the importance of your songs.

Hermes: ^"You can bring the seasons back into tune," he said.
^But there's a melody you can't quite recall...

c-0: ^She's tightly holding onto a small pack. It holds the only belongings you both own.
^Her face is starting to cave in. There's not enough food to go around.

Choices: ^"We need to find food and firewood." She says. You continue working on the lost melody. If you can fix the seasons, this harsh winter can end.
Ending: ^She gone. You have to get her back.
